resources.string: Only use Wifi to upload data
This shows cosmic ray candidates hitting your phone in real time.\n\nPrefer a black screen? You can disable live splashes in Settings.
This pane shows the status.\n\nSwipe for other views.
This view shows the current state of the app as well as:\n\tTime: seconds of data-taking\n\tRate: scan rate, frames-per-second

This view shows:
	 Frames scanned: number of video frames examined
	 Pixels scanned: number of pixels examined
	 Candidates: number of pixels above the noise threshold
On the bottom is a histogram showing the quality of the pixels above threshold.
When especially interested candidates are found, this pane will show you a gallery of images.
"This pane shows you a gallery of images of interesting candidates."
Create an account or login to see your active devices.
This pane shows a radiation dosimeter. Still in development.
CRAYFIS is unable to determine the location of your device. Please check your Location settings.
A new version of CRAYFIS is available. Click here for the update:
CRAYFIS is an app which uses your phone to look for cosmic ray particles.
Swipe left or right for other views
This device has been connected to account
This pane shows the active network map and leaderboard.
When the app has finished calibrating, this pane will show a histogram of the particle candidates.
This pane shows a histogram of the particle candidates.
CRAYFIS could not open the camera. (%d)
An internal error occurred and the activity you are currently viewing must close. Please try again.
